2:
She has slaughtered her animals; she has mixed her wine;
\q and she has set her table.
3:
She has sent out her maids; she calls out
\q from the highest points of the city,
\q
4:
"Who is naive? Let him turn aside here!"
\q To the one lacking good sense she speaks.
5:
"Come, eat my food,
\q and drink the wine I have mixed.
\q
6:
Leave your naive actions and live;
\q walk in the path of understanding.
7:
Whoever disciplines a mocker receives abuse,
\q and whoever rebukes a wicked person receives insults.
\q
9:
Give to a wise person, and he will become even wiser;
\q teach a righteous person, and he will add to his learning.
10:
The fear of Yahweh is the beginning of wisdom,
\q and the knowledge of the Holy One is understanding.
\q
11:
For through me your days will be multiplied,
\q and years of life will be added to you.
\q
12:
If you are wise, you are wise for yourself,
\q and if you mock, you will carry it by yourself."
14:
She sits at the door of her house,
\q on a seat in the highest places of the town.
\q
15:
She is calling out to those who pass by in the streets,
\q to people walking straight on their way.
16:
"Let anyone who is naive turn aside here,"
\q she says to those who have no sense.
\q
17:
"Stolen waters are sweet,
\q and bread of secrecy is delicious."
\q
18:
But he does not know that the dead are there,
\q that her invited guests are in the depths of Sheol.
